                <tei-funder data-origname="funder">
                    <tei-ref target="http://shakespeare.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/" data-origname="ref" data-origatts="target">Sprint for Shakespeare</tei-ref>
                    Crowdfunding</tei-funder>
                <tei-funder data-origname="funder">The second phase of the Bodleian First Folio project was made possible by a lead gift from Dr Geoffrey Eibl-Kaye and generous support from the Sallie Dickson Memorial Fund/Dallas Shakespeare Club Fund, Mr James Barber, and a private individual. The Bodleian Libraries are very grateful for this additional support, which brings new features to the digitized First Folio, enabling more efficient and intuitive use for all with an interest in Shakespeare, early modern drama, theatre and book history.</tei-funder>

            <tei-sourceDesc data-origname="sourceDesc">

                    <tei-title type="statement" data-origname="title" data-origatts="type"> Mr. William Shakespeares comedies, histories, &

                    <tei-pubPlace data-origname="pubPlace">

                        <tei-persName data-origname="persName">William Jaggard</tei-persName>, <tei-persName data-origname="persName">Edward

                    </tei-publisher>
                    <tei-date type="canonical" when="1623" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when type">1623</tei-date>
                    <tei-date type="entry" when="1623-11-08" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when type">8 November 1623 (entered)</tei-date>
                    <tei-idno type="shelfmark" data-origname="idno" data-origatts="type">Bodleian Library, Arch. G c.7</tei-idno>

                    <tei-idno type="alephSysNo" data-origname="idno" data-origatts="type">015592789</tei-idno>

                    <tei-note type="citation" data-origname="note" data-origatts="type">West, A.J. A Model for Describing Shakespeare First Folios,

                <tei-msDesc data-origname="msDesc">

                        <tei-country data-origname="country">United Kingdom</tei-country>

                        <tei-repository data-origname="repository">Bodleian Library</tei-repository>
                        <tei-idno type="shelfmark" data-origname="idno" data-origatts="type">Bodleian Library, Arch. G c.7</tei-idno>
                        <tei-altIdentifier type="previous" data-origname="altIdentifier" data-origatts="type">
                            <tei-idno type="shelfmark" data-origname="idno" data-origatts="type">S 2.17 Art. [first Bodleian shelfmark,
                                1624-1664?]</tei-idno>
                        </tei-altIdentifier>
                        <tei-altIdentifier type="previous" data-origname="altIdentifier" data-origatts="type">
                            <tei-idno type="shelfmark" data-origname="idno" data-origatts="type">Arch. F c.13 [superscript z?] [second Bodleian
                                shelfmark, 1906-?]</tei-idno>
                        </tei-altIdentifier>
                    </tei-msIdentifier>
                    <tei-msContents data-origname="msContents">
                        <tei-titlePage data-origname="titlePage">
                            <tei-docTitle data-origname="docTitle">
                                <tei-titlePart data-origname="titlePart">M<tei-hi rend="superscript" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">r</tei-hi> VVILLIAM <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>
                                    <tei-hi rend="large" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">SHAKESPEARES</tei-hi>
                                    <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>COMEDIES, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>HISTORIES, & <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>TRAGEDIES. </tei-titlePart>
                                <tei-titlePart data-origname="titlePart">Publiſhed according to the True Originall Copies.</tei-titlePart>
                                
                            </tei-docTitle>
                            
                            <tei-docImprint data-origname="docImprint">London : Printed by Isaac Iaggard, and Ed. Blount [at the charges
                                of W. Iaggard, Ed. Blount, I. Smithweeke, and W. Aspley].,
                                <tei-docDate data-origname="docDate">1623</tei-docDate>.</tei-docImprint>
                        </tei-titlePage>
                    </tei-msContents>
                    <tei-physDesc data-origname="physDesc">
                        <tei-objectDesc form="codex" data-origname="objectDesc" data-origatts="form">
                            <tei-supportDesc data-origname="supportDesc">
                                <tei-support data-origname="support">
                                    <tei-dimensions data-origname="dimensions">
                                        <tei-height unit="mm" data-origname="height" data-origatts="unit">349</tei-height>
                                        <tei-width unit="mm" data-origname="width" data-origatts="unit">323</tei-width>
                                    </tei-dimensions>
                                </tei-support>
                                <tei-foliation data-origname="foliation">
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">[18], 303, [1], 46, 49-100, [2], 69-232, [2], 79-80, [26], 76,
                                    79-82, 80-98, [2], 109-156, 257-993 [i.e. 399], [1] p.; fol.</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Numbering peculiarities: 1st count: p.50 misnumbered 58; p.59
                                        misnumbered 51; p.86 misnumbered 88; p.153 misnumbered 151; p.161
                                        misnumbered] 163; p.164 misnumbered 162; p. 165 misnumbered 163; p.
                                        189 misnumbered 187; p. 249 misnumbered 251; p.250 misnumbered 252; p.
                                        265 misnumbered 273 -- 2nd count: p.37 misnumbered 39 in some copies;
                                        p.89 misnumbered 91; p. 90 misnumbered 92 -- 3rd count: p.165-166
                                        numbered 167 and 168 respectively; p. 216 numbered 218 -- 5th count:
                                        p. 279 misnumbered 259; p. 282 misnumbered 280; p.308 misnumbered 38;
                                        p. 379 misnumbered 389; p. 399 misnumbered 993.</tei-p>
                                </tei-foliation>
                                <tei-collation data-origname="collation">
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">The signatures varies between sources, with the most commonly
                                    cited being Hinman's and West's: 1. Hinman: πA⁶ (πA1+1) [πB²], ²A-2B⁶
                                    2C² a-g⁶ χgg⁸ h-v⁶ x⁴ χ1.2 [para.]-2[para.]⁶ 3[para]¹ aa-ff⁶ gg² Gg⁶
                                    hh⁶ kk-bbb⁶; 2. West: πA⁶ (πA1+1, πA5+1.2)²A-2B⁶ 2C² a-g⁶ ²g⁸ h-v⁶ x⁴
                                    'gg3.4' (±'gg3') [para.]-2[para.]⁶ 3[para]¹ 2a-2f⁶ 2g² 2G⁶ 2h⁶ 2k-2v⁶
                                    x⁶ 2y-3b⁶.</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Mis-signed leaves: a3 mis-signed Aa3; ³gg1 mis-signed Gg; nn1-nn2
                                        mis-signed Nn and Nn2 and oo1 mis-signed Oo.</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">"The life and death of King Iohn" begins new pagination on leaf a1
                                        recto; "The tragedy of Coriolanus" begins new pagination on leaf aa1
                                        recto.</tei-p>
                                </tei-collation>
                                <tei-condition data-origname="condition">Lacks A1, the letterpress frontispiece entitled "To the reader".
                                    The title page is trimmed and mounted, with a section of the mount
                                    towards the foot of the leaf mutilated resulting in the loss of some the
                                    Droechout imprint at the bottom left hand corner of the portrait and the
                                    central section of an early MS note. For a full condition report,
                                    including a full survey of damage and repairs, please contact Rare
                                    Books.</tei-condition>
                                
                            </tei-supportDesc>
                            <tei-layoutDesc data-origname="layoutDesc">
                                <tei-layout data-origname="layout">
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Predominantly printed in double columns.</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Text within simple lined frame.</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Colophon reads: "Printed at the charges of W. Iaggard, Ed. Blount, I.
                                        Smithweeke, and W. Aspley. 1623.".</tei-p>
                                    <tei-p data-origname="p">Editors’ dedication signed: Iohn Heminge. Henry Condell.</tei-p>
                                </tei-layout>
                                
                            </tei-layoutDesc>
                        </tei-objectDesc>
                        <tei-decoDesc data-origname="decoDesc">
                            <tei-decoNote data-origname="decoNote">Head- and tail- pieces; initials.</tei-decoNote>
                            <tei-decoNote data-origname="decoNote">With an engraved title-page portrait of the author signed: "Martin-
                                Droeshout: sculpsit· London.". The plate exists in 2 states: 1. The earlier
                                state has lighter shading generall ; 2. Later state has heavier shading,
                                especially around the collar, and minor differences particularly with the
                                jawline and moustache. The vast majority of surviving copies have the plate
                                in the second state which has led some scholars to conclude that the earlier
                                state was a proof. The portrait in this copy is the second state.
                            </tei-decoNote>
                        </tei-decoDesc>
                        <tei-additions data-origname="additions">
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">Two MS verses on first endpaper verso: 1. 9 lines of verse by an
                            unknown author, first line reads "An active swain to make a leap was seen".
                            2. A copy of Ben Jonson’s printed "To the Reader"; MS note on t.p.
                            (mutilated) appears to read "Honest [Shakes]peare". Minor annotations on
                            leaf 2n4 (Macbeth). All in an early English hand, presumably added after
                            leaving the Library.</tei-p>
                        </tei-additions>
                        <tei-bindingDesc data-origname="bindingDesc">
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">Seventeenth-century (1624) English (Oxford) smooth calf. Bound for the
                                Bodleian Library by William Wildgoose, with evidence of two cloth ties, red
                                sprinkled edge. Formerly chained, with evidence of chain staple at the head
                                of the upper cover. Remains of paper label at the head of the spine.
                                Enclosed in 20th century book box by Maltby of Oxford. See S. Gibson in
                                Original Bodleian Copy of First Folio, p. 12-13. One of four items sent out
                                on 17th February 1624 for binding by Wildgoose containing printed waste from
                                a copy of Cicero’s "De Officiis, et al." [Deventer: Richard Pafraet, between
                                1480 and 1485] as paste-downs. For more information on this work see: Bod.
                                Inc. Cat., C-322.</tei-p>
                        </tei-bindingDesc>
                    </tei-physDesc>
                    <tei-history data-origname="history">
                        <tei-origin data-origname="origin">
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">For further details on the printing of this item see Hinman, Charleton. The
                                printing and proof-reading of the First Folio of Shakespeare: Oxford, 1963.
                            </tei-p>
                        </tei-origin>
                        <tei-acquisition data-origname="acquisition">
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">Acquired by the Bodleian in 1623, presumably in sheets. It
                            was sent out to <tei-persName data-origname="persName">William Wildgoose</tei-persName> on <tei-date when="1624-02-17" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">17 February 1624</tei-date> for binding (see: Library
                            Records e.258, fol. 48r) and upon its return chained in Duke Humfrey at
                            shelfmark S 2.17 Art. It is listed in the Bodleian’s <tei-date when="1635" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">1635</tei-date> catalogue of printed books but was gone by the publication
                            of the next catalogue in <tei-date when="1674" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">1674</tei-date>, replaced by the
                            newer <tei-bibl data-origname="bibl">
                                    <tei-title data-origname="title">Third Folio</tei-title> (<tei-date when="1664" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">1664</tei-date>)</tei-bibl>. There is no explicit reference in Library Records
                            to the disposal of this copy, but there is a record of a sale of
                            "superfluous library books" to <tei-persName data-origname="persName">Richard Davis</tei-persName>, a
                            bookseller in Oxford, in <tei-date when="1664" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">1664</tei-date> for the sum of <tei-num value="24" data-origname="num" data-origatts="value">£24</tei-num>.</tei-p>
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">After leaving the Bodleian this copy entered
                                the collection of <tei-persName data-origname="persName">Richard Turbutt</tei-persName> of Ogston Hall,
                                Derbyshire at some point in the early 18th century. It stayed in the
                                family’s possession until <tei-date when="1906" data-origname="date" data-origatts="when">1906</tei-date>, when it was
                                reacquired by the Bodleian for the sum of <tei-num value="3000" data-origname="num" data-origatts="value">£3000</tei-num>,
                                raised by public subscription. For a full discussion of the rediscovery and
                                purchase of this copy see: F. Madan, G. M. R. Turbutt and S. Gibson, The
                                Original Bodleian Copy of the First Folio of Shakespeare (theTurbutt
                                Shakespeare) (Oxford, 1905)</tei-p>
                            <tei-p data-origname="p">For a full discussion of this copy and the
                                    digital version see http://shakespeare.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/ and West and
                                    Rasmussen (2011), 31.</tei-p>
                        </tei-acquisition>
                    </tei-history>
                    <tei-additional data-origname="additional">
                        <tei-surrogates data-origname="surrogates">
                            <tei-listBibl data-origname="listBibl">
                                <tei-bibl type="digitalFacsimile" data-origname="bibl" data-origatts="type">Digital facsimile images available at: <tei-ref target="http://firstfolio.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/" data-origname="ref" data-origatts="target">http://firstfolio.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/</tei-ref>.</tei-bibl>
                            </tei-listBibl>
                        </tei-surrogates>
                    </tei-additional>
                </tei-msDesc>
            </tei-sourceDesc>
        </tei-fileDesc>
        <tei-encodingDesc data-origname="encodingDesc">
            <tei-listPrefixDef data-origname="listPrefixDef">
                <tei-prefixDef ident="a1" matchPattern="([a-z]+[a-z0-9]*)" replacementPattern="http://firstfolio.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/page-cropped/$1" data-origname="prefixDef" data-origatts="replacementPattern matchPattern ident">
                    <tei-p data-origname="p">The private URIs with the prefix 'FFimg' should be 
                        replaced with the URL pointing to the Bodleian's First Folio 
                        website.</tei-p>
                </tei-prefixDef>
            </tei-listPrefixDef>
        </tei-encodingDesc>
        <tei-profileDesc data-origname="profileDesc">
            <tei-particDesc data-origname="particDesc">
                <tei-listPerson data-origname="listPerson">
                    <tei-person xml:id="F-mnd-fai.1" id="F-mnd-fai.1" data-origname="person" data-origatts="xml:id">
                        <tei-persName type="standard" data-origname="persName" data-origatts="type">First Fairy</tei-persName>

    </tei-teiHeader>    <tei-text type="play" xml:id="F-mnd" id="F-mnd" data-origname="text" data-origatts="xml:id type">
                <tei-body data-origname="body">
                    <tei-pb facs="FFimg:axc0165-0.jpg" n="145" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n facs" data-empty=""/>
                        <tei-div type="play" data-origname="div" data-origatts="type">
                        <tei-head rend="center" data-origname="head" data-origatts="rend">A <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>MIDSOMMER <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Nights Dreame.</tei-head>
                            <tei-div type="act" n="1" data-origname="div" data-origatts="n type">
                                <tei-div type="scene" n="1" data-origname="div" data-origatts="n type">
                                    <tei-head rend="italic center" data-origname="head" data-origatts="rend">Actus primus.</tei-head>
                                    <tei-head type="supplied" data-origname="head" data-origatts="type">[Act 1, Scene 1]</tei-head>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic center" type="entrance" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Enter Theseus, Hippolita, with
                                others.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-cb n="1" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                                    <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                        <tei-speaker rend="italic center" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Theseus.</tei-speaker>
                            <tei-l n="1" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                        <tei-c rend="decoratedCapital" data-origname="c" data-origatts="rend">N</tei-c>Ow faire Hippolita, our nuptiall
                                houre</tei-l>
                            <tei-l n="2" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Drawes on apace: foure happy daies bring in</tei-l>
                            <tei-l n="3" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Another Moon: but oh, me thinkes, how slow</tei-l>
                            <tei-l n="4" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">This old Moon wanes; She lingers my desires</tei-l>
                                        <tei-l n="5" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Like to a Step‑dame, or a Dowager,</tei-l>
                            <tei-l n="6" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Long withering out a yong mans reuennew.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                                    <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hip" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hip.</tei-speaker>
                                        <tei-l n="7" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Foure daies wil quickly steep <tei-choice data-origname="choice">
                                    <tei-abbr data-origname="abbr">theēselues</tei-abbr>
                                    <tei-expan data-origname="expan">themselues</tei-expan>
                                </tei-choice> in nights</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="8" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Foure nights wil quickly dreame away the time:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="9" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And then the Moone, like to a siluer bow,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="10" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Now bent in heauen, shal behold the night</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="11" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Of our solemnities.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="12" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Go <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Philostrate</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="13" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Stirre vp the Athenian youth to merriments,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="14" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="15" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Turne melancholy forth to Funerals:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="16" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The pale companion is not for our pompe,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="17" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Hippolita, I woo'd thee with my sword,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="18" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And wonne thy loue, doing thee iniuries:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="19" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But I will wed thee in another key,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="20" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">With pompe, with triumph, and with reuelling.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic center" type="entrance" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Enter Egeus and his daughter Hermia, Lysander, 
                                <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>and Demetrius.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-ege" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Ege.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="21" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Happy be <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Theseus</tei-hi>, our renowned Duke.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="22" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Thanks good <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Egeus</tei-hi>: what's the news with thee?</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-ege" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Ege.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="23" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Full of vexation, come I, with complaint</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="24" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Against my childe, my daughter Hermia.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="25" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic center" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Stand forth Dometrius.</tei-hi>
                            </tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="26" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My Noble Lord,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="27" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">This man hath my consent to marrie her.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="28" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic center" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Stand forth Lysander.</tei-hi>
                            </tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="29" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And my gracious Duke,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="30" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">This man hath bewitch'd the bosome of my childe:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="31" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Thou, thou <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>, thou hast giuen her rimes,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="32" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And interchang'd loue‑tokens with my childe:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="33" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Thou hast by Moone‑light at her window sung,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="34" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">With faining voice, verses of faining loue,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="35" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And stolne the impression of her fantasie,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="36" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">With bracelets of thy haire, rings, gawdes, conceits,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="37" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Knackes, trifles, Nose‑gaies, sweet meats (messengers</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="38" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Of strong preuailment in vnhardned youth)</tei-l>
                                <tei-cb n="2" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                                <tei-l n="39" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughters heart,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="40" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Turn'd her obedience (which is due to me)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="41" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To stubborne harshnesse. And my gracious Duke,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="42" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Be it so she will not heere before your Grace,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="43" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Consent to marrie with <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="44" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I beg the ancient priuiledge of Athens;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="45" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">As she is mine, I may dispose of her;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="46" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Which shall be either to this Gentleman,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="47" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or to her death, according to our Law,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="48" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Immediately prouided in that case.</tei-l>
                        </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="49" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">What say you Hermia? be aduis'd faire Maide,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="50" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To you your Father should be as a God;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="51" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">One that compos'd your beauties; yea and one</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="52" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To whom you are but as a forme in waxe</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="53" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">By him imprinted: and within his power,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="54" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To leaue the figure, or disfigure it:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="55" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> is a worthy Gentleman.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="56" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So is <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="57" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">In himselfe he is.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="58" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But in this kinde, wanting your fathers voyce.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="59" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The other must be held the worthier.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="60" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I would my father look'd but with my eyes.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="61" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Rather your eies must with his iudgment looke.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="62" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I do entreat your Grace to pardon me.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="63" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I know not by what power I am made bold,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="64" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Nor how it may concerne my modestie</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="65" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">In such a presence heere to pleade my thoughts:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="66" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But I beseech your Grace, that I may know</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="67" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The worst that may befall me in this case,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="68" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">If I refuse to wed <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="69" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Either to dye the death, or to abiure</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="70" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For euer the society of men.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="71" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Therefore faire Hermia question your desires,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="72" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Know of your youth, examine well your blood,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="73" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Whether (if you yeeld not to your fathers choice)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="74" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">You can endure the liuerie of a Nunne,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="75" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For aye to be in shady Cloister mew'd,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="76" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To liue a barren sister all your life,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="77" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Chanting faint hymnes to the cold fruitlesse Moone,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="78" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Thrice blessed they that master so their blood,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="79" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To vndergo such maiden pilgrimage,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="80" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But earthlier happie is the Rose distil'd,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="81" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Then that which withering on the virgin thorne,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="82" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Growes, liues, and dies, in single blessednesse.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-fw type="sig" place="footCentre" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="place type">N</tei-fw>
                            <tei-fw type="catchword" rend="italic" place="footRight" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="place rend type">Her.</tei-fw>
                            <tei-pb facs="FFimg:axc0166-0.jpg" n="146" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n facs" data-empty=""/>
                            <tei-fw type="rh" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">A Midsommer nights Dreame.</tei-fw>
                            <tei-cb n="1" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="83" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So will I grow, so liue, so die my Lord,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="84" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Ere I will yeeld my virgin Patent vp</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="85" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Vnto his Lordship, whose vnwished yoake,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="86" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My soule consents not to giue soueraignty.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="87" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Take time to pause, and by the next new Moon</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="88" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The sealing day betwixt my loue and me,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="89" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For euerlasting bond of fellowship:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="90" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Vpon that day either prepare to dye,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="91" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For disobedience to your fathers will,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="92" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or else to wed <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> as hee would,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="93" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or on <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Dianaes</tei-hi> Altar to protest</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="94" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For aie, austerity, and single life.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-dem" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Dem.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="95" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Relent sweet <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>, and <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>, yeelde</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="96" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Thy crazed title to my certaine right.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="97" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">You haue her fathers loue, <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="98" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Let me haue <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermiaes</tei-hi>: do you marry him.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-ege" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Egeus.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="99" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Scornfull <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>, true, he hath my Loue;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="100" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">A<tei-c rend="invertedType" data-origname="c" data-origatts="rend">n</tei-c>d what is mine, my loue shall render him.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="101" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And she is mine, and all my right of her,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="102" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I do estate vnto <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="103" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I am my Lord, as well deriu'd as he,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="104" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">As well possest: my loue is more then his:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="105" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My fortunes euery way as fairely ranck'd</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="106" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">(If not with vantage) as <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="107" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And (which is more then all these boasts can be)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="108" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I am belou'd of beauteous <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="109" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Why should not I then prosecute my right?</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="110" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>, Ile auouch it to his head,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="111" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Made loue to <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Nedars</tei-hi> daughter, <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helena</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="112" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And won her soule: and she (sweet Ladie) dotes,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="113" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Deuoutly dotes, dotes in Idolatry,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="114" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Vpon this spotted and inconstant man.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-duk" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">The.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="115" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I must confesse, that I haue heard so much,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="116" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And with <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> thought to haue spoke thereof:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="117" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But being ouer‑full of selfe‑affaires,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="118" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My minde did lose it. But <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> come,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="119" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And come <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Egeus</tei-hi>, you shall go with me,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="120" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I haue some priuate schooling for you both.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="121" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For you faire <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>, looke you arme your selfe,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="122" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To fit your fancies to your Fathers will;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="123" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or else the Law of Athens yeelds you vp</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="124" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">(Which by no meanes we may extenuate)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="125" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To death, or to a vow of single life.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="126" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Come my <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hippolita</tei-hi>, what cheare my loue?</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="127" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> and <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Egeus</tei-hi> go along:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="128" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I must imploy you in some businesse</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="129" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Against our nuptiall, and conferre with you</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="130" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Of something, neerely that concernes your selues.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-ege" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Ege.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="131" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">With dutie and desire we follow you.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic rightJustified" type="exit" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Exeunt</tei-stage>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic center" type="entrance" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Manet Lysander and Hermia.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="132" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">How now my loue? Why is your cheek so pale?</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="133" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">How chance the Roses there do fade so fast?</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="134" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Belike for want of raine, which I could well</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="135" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Beteeme them, from the tempest of mine eyes.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="136" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For ought that euer I could reade,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="137" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Could euer heare by tale or historie,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="138" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The course of true loue neuer did run smooth,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="139" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But either it was different in blood.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="140" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O crosse! too high to be enthral'd to loue.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="141" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or else misgraffed, in respect of yeares.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="142" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O spight! too old to be ingag'd to yong.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="143" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or else it stood vpon the choise of merit.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="144" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O hell! to choose loue by anothers eie.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="145" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Or if there were a simpathie in choise,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="146" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Warre, death, or sicknesse, did lay siege to it;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="147" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Making it momentarie, as a sound:</tei-l>
                                <tei-cb n="2" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                                <tei-l n="148" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Swift as a shadow, short as any dreame,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="149" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Briefe as the lightning in the collied night,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="150" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">That (in a spleene) vnfolds both heauen and earth;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="151" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And ere a man hath power to say, behold,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="152" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The iawes of darknesse do deuoure it vp:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="153" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So quicke bright things come to confusion.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="154" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">If then true Louers haue beene euer crost,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="155" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">It stands as an edict in destinie:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="156" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Then let vs teach our triall patience,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="157" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Because it is a customarie crosse,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="158" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">As due to loue, as thoughts, and dreames, and sighes,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="159" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Wishes and teares; poore Fancies followers.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="160" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">A good perswasion; therefore heare me <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="161" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I haue a Widdow Aunt, a dowager,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="162" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Of great reuennew, and she hath no childe,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="163" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">From Athens is her house remou'd seuen leagues,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="164" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And she respects me, as her onely sonne:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="165" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">There gentle <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>, may I marrie thee,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="166" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And to that place, the sharpe Athenian Law</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="167" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Cannot pursue vs. If thou lou'st me, then</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="168" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Steale forth thy fathers house to morrow night:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="169" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And in the wood, a league without the towne,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="170" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">(Where I did meete thee once with <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helena</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="171" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To do obseruance for a morne of May)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="172" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">There will I stay for thee.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="173" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My good <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="174" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I sweare to thee, by Cupids strongest bow,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="175" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">By his best arrow with the golden head,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="176" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">By the simplicitie of Venus Doues,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="177" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">By that which knitteth soules, and prospers loue,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="178" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage
                                    Queene,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="179" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">When the false Troyan vnder saile was seene,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="180" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">By all the vowes that euer men haue broke,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="181" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">(In number more then euer women spoke)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="182" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">In that same place thou hast appointed me,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="183" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To morrow truly will I meete with thee.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="184" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Keepe promise loue: looke here comes <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helena</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic center" type="entrance" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Enter Helena.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="185" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">God speede faire <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helena</tei-hi>, whither away?</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hel.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="186" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Cal you me faire? that faire againe vnsay,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="187" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> loues you faire: O happie
                                    faire!</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="188" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Your eyes are loadstarres, and your tongues sweete ayre</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="189" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">More tuneable then Larke to shepheards eare,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="190" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">When wheate is greene, when hauthorne buds appeare,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="191" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Sicknesse is catching: O were fauor so,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="192" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Your words I catch, faire <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi> ere I go,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="193" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My eare should catch your voice, my eye, your eye,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="194" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">My tongue should catch your tongues sweete melodie,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="195" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Were the world mine, <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> being bated,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="196" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The rest Ile giue to be to you translated.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="197" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O teach me how you looke, and with what art</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="198" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">you sway the motion of <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> hart.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="199" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I frowne vpon him, yet he loues me still.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hel.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="200" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O that your frownes would teach my smiles 
                                    <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>such skil.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="201" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I giue him curses, yet he giues me loue.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hel.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="202" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O that my prayers could such affection mooue.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="203" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The more I hate, the more he followes me.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hel.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="204" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">The more I loue, the more he hateth me.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="205" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">His folly Helena is none of mine.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hel.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="206" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">None but your beauty, wold that fault wer mine</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="207" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Take comfort: he no more shall see my face,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="208" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi> and my selfe will flie this place.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="209" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Before the time I did <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi> see,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="210" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Seem'd Athens like a Paradise to mee.</tei-l>
                                <tei-fw type="catchword" rend="italic" place="footRight" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="place rend type">O</tei-fw>
                                <tei-pb facs="FFimg:axc0167-0.jpg" n="147" data-origname="pb" data-origatts="n facs" data-empty=""/>
                                <tei-fw type="rh" data-origname="fw" data-origatts="type">A Midsommer nights Dreame.</tei-fw>
                                <tei-cb n="1" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                                <tei-l n="211" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">O then, what graces in my Loue do dwell,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="212" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">That he hath turn'd a heauen into hell.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="213" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">
                                <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helen</tei-hi>, to you our mindes we will vnfold,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="214" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To morrow night, when <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Phoebe</tei-hi> doth behold</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="215" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Her siluer visage, in the watry glasse,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="216" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Decking with liquid pearle, the bladed grasse</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="217" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">(A time that Louers flights doth still conceale)</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="218" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Through <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Athens</tei-hi> gates, haue we deuis'd to steale.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-her" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Her.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="219" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And in the wood, where often you and I,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="220" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Vpon faint Primrose beds, were wont to lye,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="221" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Emptying our bosomes, of their counsell sweld:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="222" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">There my <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi>, and my selfe shall meete,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="223" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And thence from <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Athens</tei-hi> turne away our eyes</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="224" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To seeke new friends and strange companions,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="225" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Farwell sweet play‑fellow, pray thou for vs,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="226" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And good lucke grant thee thy <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi>.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="227" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Keepe word <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Lysander</tei-hi> we must starue our sight,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="228" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">From louers foode, till morrow deepe midnight.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic rightJustified" type="exit" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Exit Hermia.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-lys" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Lys.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="229" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I will my <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi>. <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Helena</tei-hi> adieu,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="230" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">As you on him, <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> dotes on you.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic rightJustified" type="exit" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Exit Lysander.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-hel" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Hele.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-l n="231" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">How happy some, ore othersome can be?</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="232" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Through <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Athens</tei-hi> I am thought as faire as she.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="233" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But what of that? <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> thinkes not so:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="234" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">He will not know, what all, but he doth know,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="235" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And as hee erres, doting on <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermias</tei-hi> eyes;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="236" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So I, admiring of his qualities:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="237" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Things base and vilde, holding no quantity,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="238" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Loue can transpose to forme and dignity,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="239" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Loue lookes not with the eyes, but with the minde,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="240" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And therefore is wing'd <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Cupid</tei-hi> painted blinde.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="241" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Nor hath loues minde of any iudgement taste:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="242" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Wings and no eyes, figure, vnheedy haste.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="243" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And therefore is Loue said to be a childe,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="244" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Because in choise he is often beguil'd,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="245" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">As waggish boyes in game themselues forsweare;</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="246" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So the boy Loue is periur'd euery where.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="247" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">For ere <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Demetrius</tei-hi> lookt on <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermias</tei-hi> eyne,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="248" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">He hail'd downe oathes that he was onely mine.</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="249" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">And when this Haile some heat from <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermia</tei-hi> felt,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="250" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">So he dissolu'd, and showres of oathes did melt,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="251" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">I will goe tell him of faire <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Hermias</tei-hi> flight:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="252" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Then to the wood will he, to morrow night</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="253" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">Pursue her; and for his intelligence,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="254" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">If I haue thankes, it is a deere expence:</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="255" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">But heerein meane I to enrich my paine,</tei-l>
                                <tei-l n="256" data-origname="l" data-origatts="n">To haue his sight thither, and backe againe.</tei-l>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-stage rend="italic rightJustified" type="exit" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Exit.</tei-stage>
                                </tei-div>
                                    <tei-div type="scene" n="2" data-origname="div" data-origatts="n type">
                                        <tei-head type="supplied" data-origname="head" data-origatts="type">[Act 1, Scene 2]</tei-head>
                                    <tei-stage rend="italic center" type="entrance" data-origname="stage" data-origatts="type rend">Enter Quince the Carpenter, Snug the Ioyner, Bottome the 
                                        <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Weauer, Flute the bellowes‑mender, Snout the Tinker, and 
                                        <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""/>Starueling the Taylor.</tei-stage>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Quin.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="257" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">Is all our company heere?</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-bot" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Bot.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="258" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">You were best to call them generally, man by 
                                    <tei-lb n="259" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>man, according to the scrip.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Qui.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="260" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">Here is the scrowle of euery mans name, which 
                                    <tei-lb n="261" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>is thought fit through all <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Athens</tei-hi>, to play in our Enter­
                                    <tei-lb n="262" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>lude before the Duke and the Dutches, on his wedding 
                                    <tei-lb n="263" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>day at night.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-bot" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Bot.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="264" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">First, good <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Peter Quince</tei-hi>, say what the play treats 
                                    <tei-lb n="265" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>on: then read the names of the Actors: and so grow on 
                                    <tei-lb n="266" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>to a point.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Quin.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="267" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">Marry our play is the most lamentable Come­
                                    <tei-lb n="268" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>dy, and most cruell death of <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Pyramus</tei-hi> and <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Thisbie</tei-hi>.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-bot" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Bot.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="269" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">A very good peece of worke I assure you, and a 
                           <tei-cb n="2" data-origname="cb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>
                                    <tei-lb n="270" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>merry. Now good <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Peter Quince</tei-hi>, call forth your Actors
                                    <tei-lb n="271" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>by the scrowle. Masters spread your selues.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Quince.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="272" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">Answere as I call you. <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Nick Bottome</tei-hi> the
                                <tei-lb n="273" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>Weauer.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-bot" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Bottome.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="274" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">Ready; name what part I am for, and
                                    <tei-lb n="275" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>proceed.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Quince.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="276" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">You <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Nicke Bottome</tei-hi> are set downe for <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Py­
                                    <tei-lb n="277" data-origname="lb" data-origatts="n" data-empty=""/>ramus</tei-hi>.</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-bot" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
                                <tei-speaker rend="italic" data-origname="speaker" data-origatts="rend">Bot.</tei-speaker>
                                <tei-p n="278" data-origname="p" data-origatts="n">What is <tei-hi rend="italic" data-origname="hi" data-origatts="rend">Pyramus</tei-hi>, a louer, or a tyrant?</tei-p>
                            </tei-sp>
                            <tei-sp who="#F-mnd-qui" data-origname="sp" data-origatts="who">
